dialog: Hermione!!

dialog: Hermione!!

dialog: Just relax!

dialog: Harry!

dialog: Are you okay?

dialog: Yeah, yeah, I'm fine.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Help!

dialog: He's not relaxing, is he?

dialog: Apparently not.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Help! Help me!

dialog: We've got to do something!

dialog: What?

dialog: Uh! I remember reading something in Herbology.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Help!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Um Devil's Snare, Devil's Scare,  it's deadly fun...but will sulk in the sun! That's it! Devil's Snare hates sunlight!  Lumus Solem!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Ahhh!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Ron, are you okay?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Yeah.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Okay.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Whew. Lucky we didn't panic!

dialog: Lucky Hermione pays attention in Herbology.

dialog: What is that?

dialog: I don't know. Sounds like wings.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Curious. I've never seen birds like these.

dialog: They're not birds, they're keys. And I'll bet one of them fits that door.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: What's this all about?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: I don't know. Strange.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Alohomora!  Well, it was worth a try.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Ugh! What're we going to do? There must be 1000 keys up there!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: We're looking for a big old fashioned one. Probably rusty like the handle.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: There! I see it!  The one with the broken wing!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: What's wrong, Harry?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: It's too simple.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Oh, go on, Harry! If Snape can catch it on that old broomstick, you can! You're the youngest seeker in a century!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: This complicates things a bit!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Catch the key!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Hurry up!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: I don't like this. I don't like this at all.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Where are we? A graveyard.

dialog: This is no graveyard.  It's a chessboard.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: There's the door.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Now what do we do?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: It's obvious, isn't it? We've got to play our way across the room. All right. Harry, you take the Bishop's square. Hermione, you'll be the Queen's side castle. As for me, I'll be a knight.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: What happens now?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Well, white moves first, and then...we play.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Ron, you don't suppose this is going to be like...real wizard's chess, do you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: You there! D-5!  Yes, Hermione, I think this is going to be exactly like wizard's chess!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Castle to E-4! Smash! Ron: Pawn to C-3! Smash! Boom! The Queen turns, and smashes a piece! Harry, Ron and Hermione wince. The Queen turns again. Both Ron and Harry study the game.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Wait a minute.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: You understand right, Harry. Once I make my move, the Queen will take me...then you'll be free to check the King.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: No, Ron! No!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: What is it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: He's going to sacrifice himself!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: No, Ron, you can't!  There must be another way!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Do you want to stop Snape or not? Harry, it's you that has to go on. I know it. Not me, not Hermione, you.  Knight...to H-3.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Check.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Ahhhh!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: RON!  NO! Don't move! Dont forget, we're still playing.  Checkmate.  Take care of Ron. Then, go to the owlery. Send a message to Dumbledore. Ron's right...I have to go on.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: You'll be okay, Harry. You're a great wizard, you really are.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Not as good as you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Me? Books and cleverness? There are more important things. Friendship, and bravery. And Harry, just be careful.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: You?  No. I-it can’t be. Snape, h-he was the one—-

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Yes. He does seem the type, doesn’t he? Next to him, who would suspect p-p-p-poor st-stuttering Professor Quirrell?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: But-but that day, during the Quidditch match, Snape tried to kill me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: No, dear boy. I tried to kill you.  And trust me, if Snape’s cloak hadn’t caught fire and broken my eye contact, I would have succeeded, even with Snape muttering his little countercurse.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Snape was trying to save me?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: I knew you were a danger to me right from the off. Especially after Halloween.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Then-then you let the troll in.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Very good, Potter, yes. Snape, unfortunately, wasn’t fooled. While everyone else was running about the dungeon, he went to the third floor to head me off. He, of course, never trusted me again.  He rarely left me alone. But he doesn’t understand. I’m never alone, never.  Now, what does this mirror do? I see what I desire. I see myself holding the stone. But how do I get it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Use the boy.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Come here, Potter. Now!  Tell me... what do you see?  What is it?  What do you see?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: I-I’m shaking hands with Dumbledore. I’ve won the House Cup.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: He lies.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Tell the truth! What do you see?!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Let me speak to him.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Master, you are not strong enough.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: I have strength enough for this.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Harry Potter, we meet again.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Voldemort.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Yes. You see what I’ve become? See what I must do to survive? Live off another, a mere parasite. Unicorn blood can sustain me, but it cannot give me a body of my own. But there is something that can, something that, conveniently enough, lies in your pocket.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Stop him.  Don't be a fool! Why suffer a horrific death when you can join me and live?!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Never!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Haha. Bravery. Your parents had it too. Tell me, Harry, would you like to see your mother and father again? Together, we can bring them back.  All I ask for is something in return.  That's it, Harry. There is no good and evil. There is only power, and those too weak to seek it. Together, we'll do extraordinary things. Just give me the stone!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: You liar!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Kill him!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Ahh! Ahh!  What is this magic?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Fool! Get the stone!

dialog: Good afternoon, Harry. Ah. Tokens from your admirers?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Admirers?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally, the whole school knows.  Ah, I see your friend Ronald has saved you the trouble of opening your Chocolate Frogs.

dialog: Ron was here? Is he all right? What about Hermione?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Fine. They're both just fine.

dialog: But, what happened to the Stone?

dialog: Relax, dear boy. The stone has been destroyed. My friend Nicholas and I had a little chat and agreed it was best all around.

dialog: But Flamel, he'll die, won't he?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: He has enough Elixir to set his affairs in order. But yes, he will die.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: How is it I got the Stone, sir? One minute I was staring in the mirror, and the next...

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Ah. You see, only a person who wanted to find the Stone, find it, but not use it, would be able to get it. That is one of my more brilliant ideas. And between you and me that's saying something.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Does that mean, with the Stone gone, I mean, that Voldemort can never come back?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Ah, I'm afraid there are ways in which he can return. Harry, do you know why Professor Quirrell couldn't bear to have you touch him?  It was because of your mother. She sacrificed herself for you, and that kind of act leaves a mark.  No, no, this kind of mark cannot be seen. It lives in your very skin.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: What is it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Love, Harry, love.  Ah. Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Beans. I was most unfortunate in my youth to come across a vomit flavored one, and since then I have lost my liking for them. But I think I could be safe with a nice toffee... Mm. Alas. Earwax.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: All right there, Ron?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: All right? You?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: All right. Hermione?

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Never better.

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Another year, gone! And now, as I understand it, the house cup needs awarded and the points stand thus. In fourth place: Gryffindor, with 312 points!  In third place: Hufflepuff, with 352 points!  Second: Ravenclaw, with 426 points!  And in first place, with 472 points: Slytherin house!  Yes, well done Slytherin, well done Slytherin. However, recent events must be taken into account and I have a few last minute points to award.  First, to Miss Hermione Granger, for the cool use of intellect while others were in grave peril: fifty points!  Second, to Mr Ronald Weasley, for the best played game of chess that Hogwarts has seen these many years: fifty points!  And third, to mister Harry Potter, for pure love and outstanding courage, I award Gryffindor house: sixty points!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: We're tied with Slytherin!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: And finally: it takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to your enemies, but a great deal more to stand up to your friends. I award ten points to Neville Longbottom!  Assuming that my calculations are correct, I believe that a change of decoration is in order!  Gryffindor wins the House Cup!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Yes!

movie: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
dialog: Neville!

dialog: Not now, Bopkins. For when the Masons arrive.

dialog: Dobby sir, Dobby the house elf.

dialog: Not to be to be rude or anything, but this isn't a great time for me to have a house elf in my bedroom.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

dialog: Why don't you sit down?

dialog: Dobby, ssh! I'm sorry! I didn't mean to offend you, or anything.

dialog: Offend Dobby? Dobby has heard of your greatness, sir, but never has he been asked to sit down by a wizard, like an equal.

dialog: You can't have met many decent wizards then.

dialog: Bad Dobby!

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Bad Dobby. Bad Dobby!

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Stop! Stop, Dobby. Please be quiet! Are you all right?

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Dobby had to punish himself, sir. Dobby almost spoke ill of his family, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Your family?

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: The wizard family Dobby serves, sir. Dobby is bound to serve one family forever. If they ever knew Dobby was here…ooh… But Dobby had to come. Dobby has to protect Harry Potter- to warn him. Harry Potter must not go back to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry this year! There is a plot, a plot to make most terrible things happen.

dialog: What terrible things? Who's plotting them?

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Ooo… er… can't… say… argh...

dialog: Ok– I- understand. You can't- say.

dialog: Let me go!

dialog: Get in there, and keep quiet!

dialog: What the devil are you doing up here?

dialog: I- I was just—

dialog: You just ruined the punch line of my Japanese golfer joke!

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Sorry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: One more sound, and you'll wish you'd never been born, boy! And fix that door!

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Yes, sir… See why I've got to go back? I don't belong here. I belong in your world, at Hogwarts. It's the only place I've got friends!

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Friends who don't even write to Harry Potter?

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Well, I expect they've… been- hang on- how do you know my friends haven't been writing to me?

dialog: Harry Potter mustn't be angry with Dobby. Heh- Dobby hoped, if Harry Potter thought his friends had forgotten him, Harry Potter might not want to go back to school, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Give me those, now!

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: No! Ahh! Ooh…

dialog: Dobby, get back here!

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Dobby, please, no!

dialog: Harry Potter must say he's not going back to school!

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: I can't. Hogwarts is my home!

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Then, Dobby must do it, sir, for Harry Potter's own good.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: …it spread as far as the eye could see, all over the floor of this vast building, and it was this deep. And one plumber said “Look at all that water.” A-and the second plumber said, “Yes, and that's just the top of it!”

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: I'm so sorry! It's my nephew- he's very disturbed. Meeting strangers upsets him. That's why I kept him upstairs!

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: You're never going back to that school. You're never going to see those freaky friends of yours again. Never!

dialog: Ron! Fred. George. What are you all doing here?

dialog: Oh!

dialog: Get off!

dialog: Right.

dialog: I think it's brilliant

dialog: Where have you been? Harry, how wonderful to see you dear. Beds empty! No note! Car gone! You could have died! You could have been seen! Of course, I don't blame you, Harry dear.

dialog: They were starving him, Mum. There were bars on his window!

dialog: Well, you'd best hope that I don't put bars on your window, Ronald Weasley! Come on Harry, time for a spot of breakfast. Here we are Harry. Now tuck in! That's it. There we go.

dialog: Mum- Mummy, have you seen my jumper?

dialog: Morning, Weasleys.

dialog: Morning, Dad.

dialog: Morning, Dad.

dialog: Well now. Aah! And who are you?

dialog: Professor, I was wondering if you could tell us about…the Chamber of Secrets?

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Well, very well. Well, you all know, of course, that Hogwarts was founded over a thousand years ago by the four greatest witches and wizards of the age: Godric Gryffindor, Helga Hufflepuff, Rowena Ravenclaw, and Salazar Slytherin. Now, three of the founders coexisted quite harmoniously. One did not.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Three guesses who.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Salazar Slytherin wished to be more selective about the students admitted to Hogwarts. He believed magical learning should be kept within all-magic families. In other words, “pure-bloods.” Unable to sway the others, he decided to leave the school. Now, according to legend, Slytherin had built a hidden chamber in this castle, known as the Chamber of Secrets. Though, shortly before departing, he sealed it until that time when his own true heir returned to the school. The heir alone would be able to open the Chamber and unleash the horror within, and by so doing purge the school of all those who, in Slytherin's view, were unworthy to study magic.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Muggle-borns.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Well, naturally, the school had been searched many times. No such chamber has been found.

dialog: Gather 'round, gather 'round! Can everybody see me? Can you all hear me? Excellent! In light of the dark events of recent weeks, Professor Dumbledore has granted me permission to start this little Dueling Club to train you all up in case you ever need to defend yourselves, as I myself have done on countless occasions- for full details, see my published works. movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Because I told her to. You'll find that I can be very persuasive. Not that she knew what she was doing. She was, shall we say, in a kind of trance. Still, the power of the diary began to scare her. And she tried to dispose of it in the girl's bathroom. And then, who should find it, but you? The very person I was most anxious to meet.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: But, why did you want to meet me?

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: I knew I had to talk to you, meet you if I could. So I decided to show you my capture of that brainless oaf, Hagrid, to gain your trust.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Hagrid's my friend! And you framed him, didn't you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: It was my word against Hagrid's. Only Dumbledore seemed to think he was innocent.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: I'll bet Dumbledore saw right through you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: He certainly kept an annoyingly close watch on me after that. I knew it wouldn't be safe to open the Chamber again while I was still at school, so I decided to leave behind a diary preserving my sixteen-year-old self in its pages, so that one day I would be able to lead another to finish Salazar Slytherin's noble work.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Well, you haven't finished it this time. In a few hours, the Mandrake Draught will be ready, and everyone who was Petrified will be all right again.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
dialog: Haven't I told you? Killing Mudbloods doesn't matter to me anymore. For many months now, my new target… has been you. How did you escape with nothing but a scar, while Lord Voldemort's powers were destroyed?

dialog: Why do you care how I escaped? Voldemort was after your time.

dialog: You! You're the Heir of Slytherin. You're Voldemort.

movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

dialog: Looking forward to a new term?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Yeah. It should be great.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry, some within the Ministry would strongly discourage me... from divulging what I'm about to reveal to you. But I think that you need to know the facts. You are in danger. Grave danger.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Has this anything to do with Sirius Black, sir?

dialog: What do you know about Sirius Black, Harry?

dialog: Only that he's escaped from Azkaban.

dialog: Voldemort.

dialog: Don't say his name.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sorry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: When you stopped You-Know-Who... Black lost everything. But to this day, he still remains a faithful servant. And in his mind... you are the only thing that stands in the way... of You-Know-Who returning to power. And that is why... he has escaped from Azkaban. To find you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: And kill me.

dialog: Harry, swear to me that whatever you might hear... you won't go looking for Black.

dialog: Mr. Weasley... why would I go looking for someone who wants to kill me?

dialog: Quick. Quick. Ron, Ron! Oh, for goodness' sake! Don't lose him!

dialog: I didn't mean to blow her up. I just... I lost control.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Brilliant.

dialog: Honestly, Ron, it's not funny. Harry was lucky not to be expelled.

dialog: I think I was lucky not to be arrested actually.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I still think it was brilliant.

dialog: Come on. Everywhere else is full.

dialog: Who do you think that is?

dialog: Professor R.J. Lupin.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Do you know everything? How is it she knows everything?

dialog: Oh.

dialog: Do you think he's really asleep?

dialog: Seems to be. Why?

dialog: I gotta tell you something.

dialog: Yeah.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: But they'll catch Black, won't they? I mean, everyone's looking for him.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sure. Except no one's ever broken out of Azkaban before... and he's a murderous, raving lunatic.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Thanks, Ron.

dialog: Why are we stopping? We can't be there yet.

dialog: What's going on?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I don't know. Maybe we've broken down.

dialog: Ouch, Ron. That was my foot.

dialog: There's something moving out there. I think... someone's coming aboard.

dialog: Harry. Harry, are you all right?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Thank you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Here, eat this. It'll help. It's all right. It's chocolate.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What was that thing that came?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It was a dementor. One of the guards of Azkaban. It's gone now. It was searching the train for Sirius Black. If you'll excuse me, I need to have a little word with the driver. Eat. You'll feel better.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What happened to me?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Well, you sort of went rigid. We thought maybe you were having a fit or something.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: And did either of you two... you know... pass out?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No. I felt weird, though. Like I'd never be cheerful again.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: But someone was screaming. A woman.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No one was screaming, Harry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Welcome! Welcome to another year at Hogwarts! Now, I'd like to say a few words... before we all become too befuddled by our excellent feast. First, I'm pleased to welcome Professor R.J. Lupin... who's kindly consented to fill the post... of Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher. Good luck, Professor.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Of course. That's why he knew to give you the chocolate, Harry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Potter. Is it true you fainted? I mean, you actually fainted?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Shove off, Malfoy.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: How did he find out?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Just forget it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Our Care of Magical Creatures teacher... has decided to retire... in order to spend more time with his remaining limbs. Fortunately, I'm delighted to announce... that his place will be taken by none other... than our own Rubeus Hagrid. Finally, on a more disquieting note... at the request of the Ministry of Magic... Hogwarts will, until further notice, play host to the dementors of Azkaban... until such a time as Sirius Black is captured. The dementors will be stationed at every entrance to the grounds. Now whilst I've been assured... that their presence will not disrupt our day-to-day activities... a word of caution. Dementors are vicious creatures. They'll not distinguish... between the one they hunt and the one who gets in their way. Therefore, I must warn each and every one of you... to give them no reason to harm you. It is not in the nature of a dementor to be forgiving. But you know, happiness can be found... even in the darkest of times... if one only remembers to turn on the light.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Fortuna Major. Here, listen. She just won't let me in. Fortuna Major.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No, no, no. Wait, wait. Watch this. Oh, amazing! Just with my voice.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Fortuna Major.

dialog: Yes, all right. Go in.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Thank you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: She's still doing that after three years. She can't even sing. Exactly. Hey, man. Hey, man. Oh, God. That's awful.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: She's still doing that after three years. She can't even sing. Exactly. Hey, man. Hey, man. Oh, God. That's awful.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: . Green. That's a monkey. What is that? You call that a monkey? Do not give him one again. Hey, Neville, try an elephant.

dialog: Ron, catch.

dialog: I will.

dialog: I think we have a winner.

dialog: Oh, don't try one of them. Oh, no. Look at him. His face.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Welcome, my children. In this room, you shall explore the noble art of Divination. In this room, you shall discover if you possess the Sight. Hello. I am Professor Trelawney. Together we shall cast ourselves into the future. This term, we'll focus on Tasseomancy, the art of reading tea leaves. So please, take the cup of the person sitting opposite you. What do you see? The truth lies buried like a sentence deep within a book, waiting to be read. But first, you must broaden your minds. First, you must look beyond.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What a load of rubbish.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Where did you come from?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Me? I've been here all this time.

dialog: You, boy... Is your grandmother quite well?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I think so.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I wouldn't be so sure of that. Give me the cup. Pity. Broaden your minds. Your aura is pulsing, dear. Are you in the beyond? I think you are.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sure.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Look at the cup. Tell me what you see.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh, yeah. Um... Well, Harry's got sort of a wonky cross. That's trials and suffering. And that there could be the sun and that's happiness. So... you're gonna suffer, but you're gonna be... happy about it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Give me the cup. Oh, my dear boy. My dear... you have the Grim.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: The Grin? What's the Grin? Not the Grin, you idiot. The Grim. Taking form of a giant spectral dog. It's among the darkest omens in our world. It's an omen... of death.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You don't think that Grim thing's got anything to do with Sirius Black?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh, honestly, Ron. If you ask me, Divination's a woolly discipline. Now, Ancient Runes, that's a fascinating subject.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Ancient Runes? Exactly how many classes are you taking?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: A fair few.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Hang on. That's not possible. Ancient Runes is in the same time as Divination. You have to be in two classes at once.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Don't be silly Ron. How could anyone be in two classes at once? Broaden your minds. Use your Inner Eye to see the future!.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That's it. Come on, now. Come closer. Less talking, if you don't mind. I got a real treat for you today. A great lesson. So follow me. Right, you lot. Less chattering. Form a group over there. And open your books to page 49.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Exactly how do we do that?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Just stroke the spine, of course. Goodness me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Don't be such a wimp, Longbottom.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I'm okay. Okay.

dialog: I think they're funny.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh, yeah. Terribly funny. Really Witty. God, this place has gone to the dogs. Wait until Father hears Dumbledore's got this oaf teaching classes.

dialog: Shut up, Malfoy.

dialog: D-Dementor! Dementor!

dialog: Just ignore him.

dialog: Yeah.

dialog: Isn't he beautiful? Say hello to Buckbeak.

dialog: Hagrid, exactly what is that?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That, Ron, is a hippogriff. First thing you wanna know about hippogriffs is that they're very proud creatures. Very easily offended. You do not want to insult a hippogriff. It may just be the last thing you ever do. Now, who'd like to come and say hello? Well done, Harry. Well done. Come on now. Now... you have to let him make the first move. It's only polite. So... step up. Give him a nice bow. Then you wait and see if he bows back. If he does, you can go and touch him. If not... Well, we'll get to that later. Just make your bow. Nice and low. Back off, Harry. Back off. Keep still. Keep still. Well done, Harry. Well done. Here, you big brute, you. Right. I think you can go and pat him now. Go on. Don't be shy. Nice and slow, now. Nice and slow. Slow. Not so fast, Harry. Slow down, Harry. That's it... Nice and slow. Now let him come to you. Slowly, now, slowly, slowly... That's it... Yes! Well done! Well done, Harry, well done! I think he may let you ride him now.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What?

dialog: Come on.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Hey, hey, hey!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Put you over here, just behind the wing joint. Don't pull out any of his feathers, because he won't thank you for that. Well done, Harry, and well done, Buckbeak.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That was wicked, Harry!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh, please.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Well done, well done. How am I doing me first day?

dialog: Brilliant, professor.

dialog: Malfoy, no... No! Buckbeak! Whoa, whoa, whoa... Whoa! Buckbeak! Away, you silly creature!

dialog: It's killed me! It's killed me!

dialog: Calm down! It's just a scratch!

dialog: Hagrid! He has to be taken to the hospital.

dialog: I'm the teacher. I'll do it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh You're gonna regret this.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Class dismissed!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You and your bloody chicken!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Does it hurt terribly, Draco?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It comes and it goes. Still, I consider myself lucky. Madam Pomfrey said another minute and I could've lost my arm. I couldn't do homework for weeks.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Listen to the idiot. He's really laying it on thick, isn't he?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: At least Hagrid didn't get fired.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Yeah but I heard Draco's father's furious. We haven't heard the end of this.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: He's been sighted! He's been sighted!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Who?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sirius Black!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Dufftown? That's not far from here.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You don't think he'd come to Hogwarts, do you? With dementors at every entrance?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Dementors? He's already slipped past them once. Who's to say he won't do it again?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That's right. Black could be anywhere. It's like trying to catch smoke. Like trying to catch smoke with your bare hands.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Intriguing, isn't it? Would anyone like to venture a guess... as to what is inside?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That's a boggart, that is.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Very good, Mr. Thomas. Now, can anybody tell me what a boggart looks like?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No one knows.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: When did she get here?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Boggarts are shape-shifters. They take the shape of whatever a particular person fears the most. That's what makes them so...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: So terrifying, yes, yes, yes... Luckily, a very simple charm exists to repel a boggart. Let's practice it now. Without wands, please. After me. Riddikulus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Riddikulus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Very good. A little louder and very clear. Listen: Riddikulus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Riddikulus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: This class is ridiculous.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Very good. So much for the easy part. You see, the incantation alone is not enough. What really finishes a boggart is laughter. You need to force it to assume a shape you find truly amusing. Let me explain. Uh... Neville, would you join me, please? Come on, don't be shy. Come on. Come on. Hello. Neville, what frightens you most of all?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Professor Snape.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sorry?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Professor Snape.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Professor Snape. Yes, frightens all. And I believe you live with your grandmother.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Y-Yes but I don't want that boggart to turn into her, either.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No... it won't. I want you to picture her clothes. Only her clothes, very clearly, in your mind.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: She carries a red handbag...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: We don't need to hear. As long as you see it, we'll see it. Now, when I open that wardrobe... here's what I want you to do. Excuse me. Imagine Professor Snape in your grandmother's clothes. Can you do that? Yes. Wand at the ready. One, two, three. Think, Neville, think.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Riddikulus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Wonderful, Neville, wonderful! Incredible! Okay... to the back, Neville. Everyone, form a line! Form a line! I want everyone to picture the thing they fear the very most... and turn it into something funny. Next! Ron! Concentrate. Face your fear. Be brave! Wand at the ready, Ron, wand at the ready.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Riddikulus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Yes! You see? Very good, very good! Marvelous! Absolutely, very, very enjoyable! Parvati! Next! Show us what you see. Keep your nerve. Steady.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Riddikulus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: And next! Step up, step up! Wonderful, wonderful! Here! Riddikulus! Right. Sorry about that. That's enough for today. Collect your books from the back. That's the end of the lesson. Thank you! Sorry! Sorry, you can have too much of a good thing.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Now remember, these visits to Hogsmeade village are a privilege. Should your behavior reflect poorly on the school in anyway that privilege shall not be extended again. No permission form signed, no visiting the village. That's the rule, Potter.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Those with permission, follow me. Those without, stay put.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: But professor I thought if you signed it, then I could...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I can't. Only a parent or a guardian can sign. Since I am neither, it would be inappropriate. I'm sorry, Potter. That's my final word.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Forget about it, guys. See you later.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Professor, can I ask you something?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You want to know why I stopped you facing that boggart, yes? I would've thought it'd be obvious. I assumed it would take the shape of Lord Voldemort.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I did think of Voldemort at first. But then I remembered that night on the train... and the dementor.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I'm very impressed. That suggests what you fear the most is fear itself. This is very wise.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Before I fainted... I heard something. A woman... screaming.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Dementors force us to relive our very worst memories. Our pain becomes their power.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I think it was my mother... the night she was murdered.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: The very first time I saw you, Harry, I recognized you immediately. Not by your scar, by your eyes. They're your mother, Lily's. Yes. Oh, yes. I knew her. Your mother was there for me at a time when no one else was. Not only was she a singularly gifted witch... she was also an uncommonly kind woman. She had a way of seeing the beauty in others... even, and perhaps most especially, when that person could not see it in themselves. And your father, James, on the other hand... he... He had a certain, shall we say, talent for trouble. A talent, rumor has it, he passed on to you. You're more like them than you know, Harry. In time, you'll come to see just how much.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Honeyduke's Sweetshop is brilliant, but nothing beats Zonko's Joke Shop. We never did got a chance to go to the Shrieking Shack though. You heard it's the most...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: The most haunted building in Britain. Yeah I know. What's going on?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Probably Neville forgotten the password again.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Hey!.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh, you're there.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Let me through, please. Excuse me! I'm Head Boy! Get back, all of you. No one is to enter this dormitory until it's been searched.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: The Fat Lady! She's gone!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Serves her right. She was a terrible singer.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It's not funny, Ron.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Keep calm, everyone. Break into fours. Back to your common room. Be quiet.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Make way.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: The headmaster's here.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Come on, move.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You heard. Move!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Mr. Filch? Round up the ghosts. Tell them to search every painting in the castle to find the Fat Lady.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: There's no need for ghosts, professor. The Fat Lady's there.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Mind where you're going! Slow down! You listen! I'm Head Boy! Come back here!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Keep moving!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Dear lady, who did this to you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Eyes like the devil, he's got, and a soul as dark as his name. It's him, headmaster. The one they all talk about. He's here, somewhere in the castle! Sirius Black!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Secure the castle, Mr. Filch. The rest of you, to the Great Hall.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I've searched the Astronomy Tower and the Owlery, sir. But there's nothing there.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Ah, thank you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: The third floor's clear too, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Very good.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I've done the dungeons, headmaster. No sign of Black, nor anywhere else in the castle.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I didn't really expect him to linger.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Remarkable feat, don't you think? To enter Hogwarts Castle on one's own... completely undetected?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Quite remarkable, yes.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Any theories on how he managed it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Many. Each as unlikely as the next.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You may recall... prior to the start of term I expressed concerns... about your appointment of Professor...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Not a single professor inside this castle would help Sirius Black enter it. I'm quite convinced the castle is safe... and I'm more than willing to send the students back to their houses.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What about Potter? Should he be warned?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Perhaps. But for now, let him sleep. For in dreams, we enter a world that's entirely our own. Let them swim in the deepest ocean or glide over the highest cloud.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Turn to page 394.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Excuse me, sir. Where's Professor Lupin?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That's not really your concern, is it, Potter? Suffice it to say your professor finds himself incapable of teaching... at the present time. Turn to page 394.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Werewolves?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: But sir, we just learned about red caps and hinkypunks. We're not meant to start that for weeks.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Quiet.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: When did she come in? Did you see her come in?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Now, which one of you can tell me the difference... between an Animagus and a werewolf? No one? How disappointing.

For the wizard who conjures one... it works something like a shield, with the dementor feeding on it rather than him. But in order for it to work, you need to think of a memory. Not just any memory, a very happy memory, a very powerful memory.

dialog: We'll stay with you too, Hagrid.

dialog: You'll do no such thing! Think I want you seeing something like that? No. You just drink your tea and be off. Oh. Before you do, Ron...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Scabbers! You're alive!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Keep a closer eye on your pets, Ron.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I think that means you owe someone an apology.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Right. Next time I see Crookshanks, I'll let him know.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I meant me!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Blimey! What was that?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Ow! Hagrid!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh, crikey.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Very interesting.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No, minister. Over this way.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It's late. It's nearly dark. You shouldn't be here. Someone sees you outside the castle at this time of night, you'll be in trouble. Big trouble. Particularly you, Harry. With you in a moment! Quick. Quick!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Hagrid. It'll be fine. It'll be okay.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Go on, go on!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Yes, that's the... lings you see over there...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: On the slope.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: On the slope... Ah, Hagrid.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Professor Dumbledore.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Good evening.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Minister. Just make your way through. Have a tea, if you like.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No, Hagrid, thank you. Now gentlemen...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I'd like to have a cup of tea.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Well, I think we should get down to our business, shall we? Very well. It is the decision of the Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures that the hippogriff known as Buckbeak, hereinafter called the condemned, shall be executed this day at sundown.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Dear, dear...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Now, now, Hagrid. Now, come on. All right. It'll be all right.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: The execution shall dispatch...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I thought I just saw... Never mind.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Let's go!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Buckbeak didn't mean no harm.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh, no.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: He bit me! Scabbers!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Ron. Ron! Ron!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Scabbers, come back!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Wait!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Scabbers, you bit me!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry, you do realize what tree this is?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That's not good. Ron, run!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry, Hermione, run! It's the Grim! Harry!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Ron! Ron, wait! Harry!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Help!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Ron! Ron! Ron! Ron! Come on! Move!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Duck!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh, I'm sorry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Don't worry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Where do you suppose this goes?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I have a hunch. I just hope I'm wrong.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: We're in the Shrieking Shack, aren't we?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Come on. Ron.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Ron. You're okay. The dog. Where is it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry it's a trap. He's the dog. He's an Animagus.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: If you want to kill Harry, you'll have to kill us too!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No. Only one will die tonight.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Then it'll be you!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Are you going to kill me, Harry?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Expelliarmus! Well, well, Sirius. Looking rather ragged, aren't we? Finally, the flesh reflects the madness within.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Well, you'd know all about the madness within, wouldn't you Remus? I found him.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I know.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It's him.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I understand.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Let's kill him!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No! I trusted you! And all this time, you've been his friend. He's a werewolf! That's why he's been missing classes.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: How long have you known?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Since Professor Snape set the essay.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Well, well, well, Hermione. You really are the brightest witch of your age, I've ever met.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Enough talk, Remus! Come on, let's kill him!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Wait!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I did my waiting! Twelve years of it! In Azkaban!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Very well. Kill him. But wait one more minute. Harry has the right to know why.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I know why. You betrayed my parents. You're the reason they're dead!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No, Harry it wasn't him. Somebody did betray your parents... but it was somebody who, until quite recently, I believed to be dead!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Who was it, then?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Peter Pettigrew! And he's in this room! Right now! Come out, come out, Peter! Come out, come out and play!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Expelliarmus! Vengeance is sweet. How I hoped I'd be the one to catch you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Severus...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I told Dumbledore you were helping an old friend into the castle, and now here's the proof.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Brilliant, Snape. Once again you've put your keen penetrating mind to the task and as usual come to the wrong conclusion. Now, if you'll excuse us, Remus and I have some unfinished business... to attend to.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Give me a reason. I beg you!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Severus don't be a fool.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: He can't help it. It's habit.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sirius be quiet.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Be quiet yourself Remus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh listen to you two, quarreling like an old married couple.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Why don't you run along and play with your chemistry set!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I could do it, you know. But why deny the dementors? They're so longing to see you. Do I detect a flicker of fear? Oh, yes. A Dementor's Kiss. One can only imagine what that must be like. It's said to be nearly unbearable to witness, but I'll do my best.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Severus, please.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: After you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Expelliarmus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry! What did you just do?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You attacked a teacher!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Tell me about Peter.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: He was at school with us. We thought he was our friend!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No. Pettigrew's dead. You killed him!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No, he didn't. I thought so too, until you mentioned seeing Pettigrew on the map!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: The map was lying, then.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: The map never lies! Pettigrew's alive! And he's right there!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Me?! He's mental!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Not you! Your rat!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Scabbers has been in my family for...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Twelve years? Curiously long life for a common garden rat! He's missing a toe, isn't he?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: So what?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: All they could find of Pettigrew was his...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Finger! That dirty coward cut it off so everyone would think he was dead! And then he transformed into a rat!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Show me. Give it to him, Ron.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What are you trying to do to him? Scabbers! Leave him alone! Get off him! What are you doing?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Remus? Sirius. My old friends! Harry! Look at you! You look so much like your father! Like James! We were the best of friends...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: How dare you speak to Harry! How dare you talk about James in front of him!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You sold James and Lily to Voldemort, didn't you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I didn't mean to! The Dark Lord. You have no idea the weapons he possesses! Ask yourself, Sirius! What would you have done? What would you have done?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I would have died! I would have died, rather than betray my friends!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry, James wouldn't have wanted me killed! Your dad... Your dad would have spared me! He would show me mercy!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You should've realized, Peter, that if Voldemort didn't kill you, then we would! Together!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry, this man...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I know what he is. But we'll take him to the castle.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Bless you, boy! Bless you!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Get off! I said we'd take you to the castle. After that, the dementors can have you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sorry about the bite. I reckon that twinges a bit.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: A bit? A bit? You almost tore my leg off!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I was going for the rat. Normally, I have a very sweet disposition as a dog. In fact, more than once, James suggested that I make the change permanent. The tail I could live with. But the fleas, they're murder.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Okay.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You better go.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No. Don't worry, okay? It's fine. I'll stay.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You go, I'll stay.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You okay?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I'm fine. Go.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That looks really painful.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: So painful. They might chop it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I'm sure Madam Pomfrey will fix it in a heartbeat.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It's too late. It's ruined. It'll have to be chopped off.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It's beautiful, isn't it? I'll never forget the first time I walked through those doors. It'll be nice to do it again as a free man. That was a noble thing you did back there. He doesn't deserve it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Well I just didn't think my dad would have wanted his two best friends... to become killers. Besides, dead, the truth dies with him. Alive, you're free.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Turn me into a maggot! Turn me into a flobberworm! Anything but the dementors! Ron! Haven't I been a good friend? A good pet? You won't let them give me to the dementors, will you? I was your rat! Sweet girl! Clever girl! Surely you won't let them...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Get away from her!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I don't know if you know, Harry... but when you were born, James and Lily made me your godfather.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I know.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I can understand if you choose to stay with your aunt and uncle... but if you ever wanted a different home...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What? Come and live with you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It's just a thought. I can understand if you don't want to.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Remus, my old friend! Have you taken your potion tonight? You know the man you truly are, Remus! This heart is where you truly live! This heart here! This flesh is only flesh!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Expelliarmus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Remus! Remus! Run! Run!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Come on.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Wait! Wait!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Hermione! Bad idea. Bad idea.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Professor? Professor Lupin?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Nice doggy. Nice doggy!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: There you are, Potter!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sirius!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Come back here, Potter!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sirius! No. Sirius! Expecto Patronum!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I saw my dad.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: He sent the dementors away. I saw him across the lake.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Listen Harry, they've captured Sirius. Any minute the dementors are going to perform the Kiss.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You mean they're gonna kill him?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No. It's worse. Much worse. They're going to suck out his soul. Headmaster, you've got to stop them. They've got the wrong man.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It's true. Sirius is innocent.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It's Scabbers who did it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Scabbers?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: He's my rat, sir. He's not really a rat. He was a rat. He was my brother Percy's rat. But then they gave him an owl...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: The point is, we know the truth. Please believe us.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I do, Miss Granger. But the word of three 13-year-old wizards will convince few others. A child's voice, however honest and true... is meaningless to those who have forgotten how to listen. Mysterious thing, time. Powerful... and when meddled with, dangerous. Sirius Black is in the topmost cell of the Dark Tower. You know the laws, Miss Granger. You must not be seen. And you would do well, I feel, to return before this last chime. If not, the consequences are too ghastly to discuss. If you succeed tonight... more than one innocent life may be spared. Three turns should do it, I think. Oh, and by the way. When in doubt, I find retracing my steps to be a wise place to begin. Good luck.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What the bloody hell was that all about?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sorry, Ron, but seeing as you can't walk...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What just happened? Where's Ron?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: 7:30. Where were we at 7:30?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I don't know. Going to Hagrid's?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Come on. And we can't be seen.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Hermione! Hermione! Hermione, wait. Hermione, will you please tell me what it is we're doing?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You foul, loathsome, evil little cockroach!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That's us.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Hermione, no! He's not worth it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: This is not normal.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: This is a Time-Turner, Harry. McGonagall gave it to me first term. This is how I've been getting to my lessons all year.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You mean we've gone back in time?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Yes. Dumbledore obviously wanted us to return to this moment. Clearly, something happened he wants us to change.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Good punch.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Thanks. Malfoy's coming.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Run.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Not a word to anyone, understood? I'm gonna get that jumped-up mudblood! Mark my words.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That felt good.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Not good, brilliant.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Come on. We should be at Hagrid's.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Look. Buckbeak's still alive.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Of course. Remember what Dumbledore said? If we succeed, more than one innocent life could be spared. Let's go.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Here they come. I'd better hurry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Fudge has to see Buckbeak before we steal him. Otherwise, he'll think Hagrid set him free.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Scabbers, you're alive!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Keep a closer eye on your pet, Ron.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That's Pettigrew.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry, you can't.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: He betrayed my parents. You don't expect me to sit here.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Yes, and you must! Harry, you're in Hagrid's hut now. If you just go bursting in, you'll think you've gone mad. Awful things happen to wizards who meddle with time. We can't be seen.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Fudge is coming. And we aren't leaving? Why aren't we leaving?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Are you mad?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Ow!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Ow! That hurt!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Sorry. We're coming out the back door. Go!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Is that really what my hair looks like from the back?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I thought I just saw... Never mind.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Let's go.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Okay, go, Harry. Go!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Get away. Get off.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Minister, I really think I should sign as well.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Yes, very well. Perhaps it would be...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Okay, Buckbeak. Come quickly. Come with us now. Come on.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Keep trying. Come on. Quickly. Buckbeak. Okay? Quickly. Hurry up. Okay?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Your name only.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It's such a very long name...

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Hurry up now, Buckbeak, okay? Come on. Come on, Buckbeak. Come and get the nice dead ferret. Come on. It's here. Come on, Beaky.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Here we are, minister. Follow me. Now, look there.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Where?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Look beyond the rocks.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: What am I supposed to see?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Professor Dippet had that ling planted when he was headmaster.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Oh, yes. Indeed, indeed.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: And all the strawberries, you see?.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Come on, Buckbeak. Come on.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I see no strawberries.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Over there.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Where?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Over there.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: This way.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Let's get this over, please.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: All right.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: But where is it? I saw the beast, just now. Not a moment ago!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: How extraordinary.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Buckbeak.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Come now, Dumbledore. Someone's obviously released him.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Hagrid?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Buckbeak.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: I don't think the minister's suggesting you had anything to do with this. How could you? You've been with us all the time.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Right. Well, well. We must search the grounds.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Well, search the skies, if you must, minister. Meanwhile, I'd like a nice cup of tea or a large brandy. Oh, executioner, your services are no longer required. Thank you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You'll find no small glasses in this house, professor.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Come on. This way. This way, now. Now what?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: We save Sirius.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: How?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: No idea. Look. It's Lupin.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Immobulus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: And Snape's coming.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: And now we wait.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: And now we wait.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: At least someone's enjoying himself.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Yeah. Hermione?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Yeah?

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Before, down by the lake, when I was with Sirius... I did see someone. That someone made the dementors go away.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: With a Patronus. I heard Snape telling Dumbledore. According to him... only a really powerful wizard could have conjured it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: It was my dad. My dad conjured the Patronus.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Harry, but your dad's... Dead. I know. I'm just telling you what I saw.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: Here we come.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: You see Sirius talking to me there? He's asking me to come live with him.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: That's great.

movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
dialog: When we free him, I'll never have to go back to the Dursleys'. It'll just be me and him. We could live in the country... someplace you can see the sky. I think he'll like that after all those years in Azkaban.

movie: Harry Potter and the Gobelt of Fire
dialog: So Hogwarts has been choosen to host a legendary event. The Tri-Wizard tournament. Now for those of you who do not know, the tri-wizard tournament brings together three schools for a series of magical contests. From each school a single contestant is selected to compete. Now let me be clear, if choosen you stand alone. And trust me when I say these contests are not for the faint hearted, but more of that later. For now please join me in welcoming the lovely ladies of the Beauxbatons Academy of magic and their headmistress Madam Maxime.

dialog: Next time there's a ball pluck up the courage and ask me before somebody else does, and not as a last resort.
