movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Oh shut up.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Ron.  Stop.  You're making it snow.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Huh?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Tell me again how I broke up with Lavender?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Um, well, she came to visit you in the hospital, you see, and you talked -- I don't believe it was a long conversation --

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Don't get me wrong.  I'm bloody thrilled to be shot of her.  It's just she seems... a bit put out.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Does, doesn't she?  And you say you don't remember a thing from that night?  Not one thing?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Well... there is... something. But no.  It can't be.  Besides, I was completely boggled, wasn't I?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Right.  Boggled...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: That's Katie.  That's Katie Bell.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: How are you, Katie?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Give me a moment, girls.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I know you're going to ask, Harry. But I don't know who cursed me. I've tried to remember.  Honestly. But I just... can't...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Cruci--

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Sectumsempra!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Don't touch me!  Don't you dare touch me!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: You have to get rid of it.  Today.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Take my hand.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: The Room of Requirement...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Over the years, if someone had a secret, if they wanted to conceal something, this is where they came.  Some of these things are almost as old as the castle itself.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Who showed you this?  First.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Fred and George.  First year.  I hid Tom Riddle's diary here for a time.  Wish I'd left it...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: What was that?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: See, you never know what you'll find up here.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: All right.  Close your eyes.  That way you can't be tempted.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: There's something else.  Another secret of sorts.  One of mine...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: That can stay hidden up here too, if you like.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: So.  Did you and Ginny do it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: What?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: You know.  Hide the book.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Oh.  Yeah.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Still no luck with Slughorn, I take it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Say that again.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Well?  How do you feel?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Excellent.  Really excellent.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Now remember.  Slughorn usually eats early, takes a short walk and then returns to his office.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Right.  I'm going down to Hagrid's.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: What?  No, Harry -- you've got to go see Slughorn.  We have a plan --

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: No.  I've got a good feeling about going to Hagrid's.  I feel like it's the place to be tonight, know what I mean?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: No.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: No.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Trust me.  I know what I'm doing. Or at least Felix does.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Merlin's beard, Harry!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Sorry, sir.  I should've announced myself.  Cleared my throat. Coughed.  You probably feared I was Madam Sprout.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Well, yes, actually -- Why would you think that?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Just the general behavior, sir. The sneaking around.  The jumping when you saw me.  By the way, those Tentacula leaves -- they're quite valuable, aren't they?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Ten galleons a leaf to the right buyer -- not that I'm familiar with such back alley transactions. One hears rumors is all.  My own interests are purely academic, of course.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Personally, these plants have always kind of freaked me out.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Exactly how did you get out of the castle, Harry?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Through the front doors, sir.  I'm off to Hagrid's, you see.  He's a very dear friend and I felt like paying him a visit.  So if you don't mind, I'll be going.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Harry!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Sir?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: It's nearly nightfall.  Surely you realize I can't allow you to roam the grounds all by yourself.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Well, then by all means come along, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Harry, I must insist you accompany me back to the castle immediately!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: That would be counterproductive, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: And what makes you say that?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: No idea.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Merlin's beard...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Is that an actual Acromantula?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: A dead one, I think, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: 'Arry.  'Orace.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: My god, dear man.  How did you ever manage to kill it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Kill 'im! Me oldest friend, 'e was!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I'm sorry, I... didn't realize.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Ah, don' worry yerself.  Yer not alone.  Seriously misunderstood creatures -- spiders.  It's the eyes, I reckon.  Unnerve people.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Not to mention the pincers.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I reckon that too... How'd yeh get outta the castle anyways?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Through the front doors.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Hagrid.  I wouldn't want to be indelicate, but Acromantula venom is uncommonly rare and, well, if you wouldn't mind my extracting a vial or two -- purely for academic pursuits...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Don' suppose it's doin' 'im any good, izzit?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: My thoughts exactly!  Always carry a few spare ampoules for just such occasions.  Old Potion Master's habit, you know...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Wish yeh coulda seen 'im in 'is prime.  Magnificent 'e was.  Jus' magnificent...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Why don't I say a few words?  I trust he had family?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Oh yeah.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Farewell...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Aragog.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Farewell, Aragog, king of arachnids.  Though your body will decay, your spirit lingers on in the quiet, web-spun places of your Forest home.  May your many-eyed descendents ever flourish and your human friends find solace for the loss they have sustained.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Tha' was... tha' was... beautiful.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: And Odo the hero, they bore him back home...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: To the place he'd known as a lad, They laid him to rest with his hat inside out and his wand snapped in two, which was sad...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I had 'im from an egg, yeh know. Tiny little thing he was when he hatched.  No bigger'n a Pekinese.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Sweet.  I once had a fish. Francis.  Lovely little thing. One day I came downstairs and he'd vanished.  Poof.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Tha's odd.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Isn't it?  That's life, I suppose. One goes along and then... poof.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: That's never unicorn hair, Hagrid?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Hagrid looks up, reels a bit.  Nods.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: But my dear chap, do you know how much that's worth?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: No idea... no idea at all...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: It was a student who gave me Francis.  One spring afternoon I discovered a bowl upon my desk with a few inches of clear water. There was a flower petal floating upon the surface.  As I watched, the petal sank, but just before it touched bottom... it transformed. Into a wee fish.  It was beautiful magic, wondrous to behold.  The petal had come from a lily.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Your mother.  The day I came downstairs, the day I found the bowl empty... was the day she...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I know what you want.  But I can't give it to you.  It will ruin me...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Do you know why I survived?  The night I got this.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Because of her.  Because she sacrificed herself.  Because she refused to step aside.  Because her love was more powerful than Voldemort.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Please don't say his --

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I'm not afraid of the name, Professor.  And I'm not afraid of him.  And you shouldn't be either. She didn't just die for me that night.  She died for you too.  She died for everyone who's ever woken in the middle of the night afraid a Death Eater waited on their doorstep.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Professor.  I'm going to tell you something, something others have only guessed at.  It's true.  I am the Chosen One.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Only I can kill him.  But in order to do so, I need to know what Tom Riddle asked you that night in your office all those years ago. And I need to know what you told him.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Be brave, Professor.  Be brave like my mother.  Otherwise you disgrace her.  Otherwise she died for nothing.  Otherwise, the bowl remains empty forever.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Don't think too badly of me once you've seen it.  You don't know what he was like... even then.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: How is he?  Horace?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Sir, is it true that Professor Merrythought is retiring?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Now, Tom, I couldn't tell you if I knew, could I?  I must say, m'boy, I'd like to know where you get your information.  More knowledgable than half the staff, you are. By the way, thank you for the pineapple -- you're quite right, it is my favorite -- how is it you knew?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Intuition.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Good gracious, is it that time already?  Off you go, boys, or Professor Dippett will have us all in detention.  Lestrange, Avery, don't forget your essays...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Look sharp, Tom.  You don't want to be caught out of bed after hours...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I know a secret shortcut or two.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Yes, I imagine you do.  Something on your mind, Tom?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Yes, sir.  I couldn't think of anyone else to go to.  The other Professors, well, they're not like you.  They might... misunderstand.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Go on.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I was in the library the other night, in the Restricted section, and I read something rather odd, about a bit of rare magic and I thought perhaps you could illuminate me.  It's called, as I understand it... a Horcrux.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Excuse me?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Horcrux.  I came across the term while reading and I didn't fully understand it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I'm not sure what you were reading, Tom, but that's very Dark stuff, very Dark indeed.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Yes, sir.  Which is why I came to you.  I mean no disrespect to the rest of the staff, but I thought if anyone could tell me... it would be you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: A Horcrux is an object in which a person has concealed part of their soul.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Yes, I thought it might be something like that.  But I don't understand how that works, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: One splits one's soul and hides part of it in an object.  By doing so, you are protected should you be attacked and your body destroyed.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Protected?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: That part of your soul that was hidden, lives on.  In other words, you cannot die.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: How does one split his soul, sir?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I think you can guess the answer to that, Tom.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Murder.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Yes.  Killing rips the soul apart. It is a violation against nature. After, one is never the same.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Out of curiosity, sir -- can you only split your soul once?  For instance, isn't seven the most powerfully magical number --

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Seven!  Merlin's beard, Tom! Isn't it bad enough to think of killing one person?  To rip the soul into seven pieces...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: This is all hypothetical, isn't it, Tom?  All academic...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Of course, sir.  And I promise I'll not speak of our conversation.  It'll be our little secret...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Sir --

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: This is beyond anything I imagined.  In my life I have seen things that are unimaginably horrific.  I know now... you will see worse.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Do you mean to say he succeeded, sir?  In making a Horcrux?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Oh he succeeded.  And not just once.  Think, Harry.  He's just told us.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Seven.  He made seven -- the most powerfully magical number.  But... what are they exactly?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: They can be anything.  The most commonplace of objects.  A ring, for example.  Or a book...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Tom Riddle's diary --

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: It's a Horcrux, yes.  Four years ago, when you saved Ginny Weasley's life in the Chamber of Secrets, when you brought me this I knew.  This was a different kind of magic.  Very dark.  Very powerful.  But until tonight, I had no idea just how powerful...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: And the ring...?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Belonged to Voldemort's mother. It was difficult to find and...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: ... even more difficult to destroy. But if you could find them all. If you did destroy each Horcrux...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: One destroys Voldemort.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: But how would you find them?  They could be hidden anywhere, couldn't they...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: True.  But magic, especially Dark magic...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: ... leaves traces.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: It's where you've been going, isn't it, sir?  When you leave the school.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Yes.  And I think... perhaps... I may have found another.  But this time I cannot hope to destroy it alone.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Once again, I shall ask too much of you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Harry.  It's time.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Hermione, is the Room of Requirement unplottable?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: If one wants it to be.  Why?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: It would explain why I thought Malfoy was leaving the castle when he disappeared off the Map.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: He was going to the Room of Requirement.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Of course, and that explains the Vanishing Cabinet as well!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: No.  I got an owl from Dad this morning.  The one at Borgin & Burke's?  It's still there.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: But I'm telling you.  I saw it --

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: What if there are two?  Vanishing cabinets.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: What if there are?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I don't know...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Good luck, mate.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I don't need luck.  I'll be with Dumbledore.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Have you ever considered that you ask too much?  That you take too much for granted?  Has it ever crossed your brilliant mind that I don't want to do this anymore?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Whether it has or hasn't is irrelevant.  I will not negotiate this with you, Severus.  You agreed.  There's nothing more to discuss.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Harry.  You need a shave, my friend.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: At times I forget how much you've grown.  At times I still see the small boy from the cupboard. Forgive my mawkishness, Harry.  I am an old man.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: You look the same to me, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Like your mother, you are unfailingly kind.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: A trait people never fail to undervalue.  I'm afraid.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: The place to which we journey tonight is exceedingly dangerous, Harry.  I promised that you could accompany me and I stand by that promise.  But there is a condition:  You must obey any command I give you -- without question.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Yes, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Understand what I'm saying. Should I tell you to hide, you must hide.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Should I tell you to run, you will run.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: And should I tell you to abandon me and save yourself...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: You will do so.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Your word, Harry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: My word.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Take my arm.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Sir, I thought one couldn't Apparate within Hogwarts.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Being me has its privileges.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: It's there, isn't it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: This is the place.  Oh yes, this place has known magic. Where you stand, Harry, Tom Riddle once stood many, many years ago, when he was but a poor orphan boy with a penchant for cruelty...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: One wintry afternoon, he lured two younger classmates to this cave. What happened is unclear.  But this much is known:  the children were damaged.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Sir!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: In order to gain passage, payment must be made, payment intended to weaken any intruder.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: You should've let me, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Oh, no, Harry.  Your blood is much more precious than mine.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Careful.  The water.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: It's there.  The only question is how do we get to it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: We couldn't, perhaps, just try a Summoning Charm, sir?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Accio Horcrux!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Perhaps not.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: If you would, Harry...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Sir... have you ever taken Felix Felicis?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Only recreationally.  You see, I believe one creates one's own luck.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Professor... there are bodies in this lake.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Yes.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Remember... the water.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Do you think the Horcrux is in there, sir?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Oh yes.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: It has to be drunk.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: You remember the condition on which I brought you with me? This potion might paralyze me.  It might cause me to forget why I'm here.  It might create so much pain I beg for relief.  You are not to indulge these requests, Harry.  It is your job to make sure I keep drinking this potion even if you have to force it down my throat.  Understood?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Why can't I drink it, sir?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Because I am much older, much cleverer... and much less valuable. Your good health, Harry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Professor?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Professor?  Can you hear me?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Don't... don't make me...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: You... you can't stop, Professor. You've got to keep drinking.  Like you said.  Remember.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Nooooooo!!!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Make it stop... Please... make it stop...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: It will, sir.  It'll stop.  But only if you drink...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: My fault.  It's all my fault...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Too much... I can't... take it... I want... to die... kill... kill me... KILL ME, HARRY!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: What?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Your word, Harry!  Your word!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: No...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Kill me!  It's the only way!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: One more.  Just one more.  And then -- I promise... I'll do what you say.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I promise.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Water. Water...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Aguamenti.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: You did it, sir.  Look --

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Water!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I'm trying, sir.  I'm --

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Go...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: We have to... go.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Don't worry, sir.  We're nearly there.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I am not worried, Harry.  I am with you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: To your Houses.  No dawdling.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: We need to get you up to the hospital, sir, to Madam Pomfrey --

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: No.  Severus... Severus is who I need... Go and wake him... Tell him what has happened...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Speak to no one else... I... I shall wait here...

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: All right.  Okay.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Sir, are you... praying?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: No, Harry.  I do not pray.  I was merely closing a window -- the one that had allowed us to Apparate.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Hide yourself below.  And do not speak or show yourself without my permission.  No matter what.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Do as I say, Harry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Trust me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Good evening, Draco.  What brings you out on such a fine Spring evening?  Or is it Summer?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Who else is here?  I heard you talking.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I often talk aloud to myself.  I find it extraordinarily useful. That which sounds sane at a whisper can seem utterly mad when said for all the world to hear. Haven't been whispering to yourself, have you, Draco?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: You are not an assassin, Draco.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: How do you know what I am?  I've done things that would shock you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Like cursing Katie Bell and hoping she would, in turn, bear a cursed necklace to me?  Like replacing a bottle of mead with one laced with poison.  Forgive me, Draco, but these are attempts so feeble I cannot help but question if your heart has been really in them. I'm curious.  When Voldemort gave you this task, when he asked you to kill me, was it in a whisper?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: He trusts me!  I was chosen!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Then I shall make it easy for you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Expelliarumus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: Well done, Draco.  But I warn you. Killing is not nearly as easy.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: You're not alone.  Are you.  There are others.  How?

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: The Vanishing Cabinet in the Room of Requirement.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: That cabinet has been broken for years.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
dialog: I've been mending it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

We may have compromised the Ministry, but there are those who remain loyal to him.  As long as the Ministry stands, his allies within will have the means at their disposal to insure his safety.

I will have to do it with another's wand.
