movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: That treacherous old bleeder!  Is there no one we can trust!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: They've kidnapped Luna because he supported me.  He was just desperate.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: I'll do the enchantments.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Hello, beautiful.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Ah, Tom, I thought you would come one day.  But surely you must know I no longer have what you seek...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: If not you, then who?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: You're so innocent, Tom.  Like a schoolboy.  There's so much you don't understand...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Tell me, Grindelwald.  Tell me where to find it!  Tell me who possesses it!  The name, Grindelwald!  The name!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Can't you guess, Tom?  It lies with him, of course.  Buried within the earth.  It is he who possesses it, even in death.  Your old friend and mine... Dumbledore.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: They exist.  The Hallows.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: But he only wants the one, the last one.  That's what he's been looking for.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: What're you saying?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: He knows where it is, You-Know- Who.  He'll have it by the end of the night.  He's found the Elder Wand.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Don't touch her!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Stop it!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Your boyfriend'll get worse than that if he doesn't behave, lovely.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: What happened to you, ugly?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: What's your name?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Dudely.  Vernon Dudley.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Check the list.  And you, ginger?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Stan Shunpike.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Like 'ell you are.  We know skinny Stan.  Try again.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Weasley... Barney Weasley.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Weasley, eh?  Wouldn't be related to that blood traitor Arthur Weasley, would you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Piss off!  Arthur Weasley's ten times the wizard you are!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Worth ten times you if I can find him.  Wasn't you that tipped him off, was it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: How 'bout you, lovely?  What do they call you...?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Penelope Clearwater.  Half-blood.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: You smell like vanilla, Penelope. I think you're going to be my favorite.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: There's no Vernon Dudley on 'ere.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Hear that, ugly?  The list says you're lying.  How come you don't want us to know who you are?  Hm?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: The list is wrong.  I told you who I am --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Change of plans, boys.  We won't be taking this lot to the Ministry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: What did you put on me?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: A Stinging Jinx.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: How long will it last?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Not long.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Show me. Get Draco. Well?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: I can't be sure.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Draco. Look closely, son. If we are the ones to hand Potter over to the Dark Lord... ...everything would be forgiven. All would be as it was, you understand?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Now, we won't be forgetting who actually caught him, I hope, Mr. Malfoy.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: You dare to talk to me like that in my own house?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Lucius. Don't be shy, sweetie. Come over. Now, if this isn't who we think it is, Draco, and we call him, he'll kill us all. We need to be absolutely sure.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: What's wrong with his face?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Yes, what is wrong with his face?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: He came to us like that. Something he picked up in the forest, I reckon.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Or ran into a Stinging Jinx. Was it you, dearie? Give me her wand. We'll see what her last spell was. Ah. Got you. What is that? Where'd you get that from?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: It was in her bag when we searched her. Reckon it's mine now. Are you mad? Go! Get out!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Cissy, put the boys in the cellar. I want to have a little conversation with this one, girl-to-girl.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: What are we gonna do? We can't leave Hermione alone with her.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Ron? Harry?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Luna?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: That sword is meant to be in my vault at Gringotts. How did you get it? What else did you and your friends take from my vault?!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: I didn't take anything. Please. I didn't take anything.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: I don't believe it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: We have to do something.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: There's no way out of here. We've tried everything. It's enchanted.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Please! please!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Shut up!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: You're bleeding, Harry. That's a curious thing to keep in your sock.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Help us.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Let her go.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Shut up. Get back. You, goblin, come with me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Aah!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Dobby? What are you doing here?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Dobby has come to rescue Harry Potter, of course. Dobby will always be there for Harry Potter.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: You can Apparate in and out of this room? Could you take us with you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Of course, sir. I'm an elf.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Works for me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Dobby, I want you to take Luna and Mr. Ollivander--

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Shell Cottage on the outskirts of Tinworth. Trust me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Whenever you're ready, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Sir? I like her very much. Meet me at the top of the stairs in 10 seconds.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Ow.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Who gets his wand?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: I'm only going to ask you once more, goblin. Think very, very carefully before you answer.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: I don't know.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: You don't know? Why weren't you doing your job? Who got into my vault? Who stole it? Who stole it? Well?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: When I was last in your vault, the sword was there. Oh, well then, perhaps it just walked out on its own then.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: There is no place safer than Gringotts.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Liar! Consider yourself lucky, goblin. The same won't be said for this one.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Like hell.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Expellliarmus!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Stupefy.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Stop! Drop your wands. I said, drop them! Pick them up, Draco, now. Well, well, well, look what we have here. It's Harry Potter. He's all bright and shiny and new again, just in time for the Dark Lord. Call him. Call him.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Stupefy!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Stupid elf. You could've killed me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Dobby never meant to kill. Dobby only meant to maim or seriously injure.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: How dare you take a witch's wand? How dare you defy your masters?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Dobby has no master. Dobby is a free elf. And Dobby has come to save Harry Potter and his friends.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Hermione. You're all right. We're safe. We're all safe.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Harry Potter.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Dobby. Dobby. No, just-- Hold on. Hold on. Look, just hold on, okay? We'll fix you. Hermione will have something. In your bag. Hermione? Hermione? What is it? Help me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: Such a beautiful place... ...to be with friends. Dobby is happy to be with his friend... ...Harry Potter.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: We should close his eyes. Don't you think? There. Now he could be sleeping.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
dialog: I want to bury him. Properly. Without magic.

movie: movie
dialog: dialog

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It's beautiful here.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It was our Aunt's. We used to come here as kids. The Order uses it now as a safe house -- what's left of us, at least.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Muggles think these keep evil away. But they're wrong...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I need to talk to the goblin.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: How are you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Alive.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You probably don't remember --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Yes.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: And brought me here.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You are a very unusual wizard.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Why did you leave Gringotts?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Soon the Death Eaters will control it. That was unacceptable to me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Then you're on our side.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: This is a wizard's war. I take no side.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It is impossible.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Alone, yes. With you, no.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: How did you come by this sword?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It's complicated. Why did Bellatrix Lestrange think it should be in her vault at Gringotts?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It's complicated.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: The sword presented itself to us in a moment of need. We didn't steal it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: There is a sword in Madam Lestrange's vault identical to this one, but it is a fake. It was placed there this past summer.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: And she never suspected?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: The replica is very convincing. Only a goblin would recognize that this is the true Sword of Gryffindor.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Who put it there? The fake.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It was not my place to ask, nor did I desire to. There are more than a few curious things in the vaults at Gringotts.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: And in Madam Lestrange's vault as well?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Perhaps.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I have no interest in gold.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Then what? The goblin twists the curl at his chin... then his eyes

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: That is my price.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I have your word, Harry Potter, that you will give me the Sword of Gryffindor if I help you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Harry, are you thinking there's a Horcrux in Bellatrix's vault?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: She was terrified when she thought we'd been in there. She kept asking you what else we'd taken. I'd bet anything there's a Horcrux there. If we find it, we can kill it. And if we kill it, we're one step closer to killing him.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: And if we find one? How're we supposed to destroy it if we've given Griphook the sword?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I'm still working on that part.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He's too weak.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Forgive me if I don't get up.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Mr. Ollivander, I need to ask you a few questions.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Anything, m'boy, anything.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Can you identify these, sir?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Walnut and dragon heartstring. Twelve and three quarter inches. Unyielding. This belongs to Bellatrix Lestrange.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: And this?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Hawthorn. Unicorn hair. Ten inches. Reasonably pliant. This was the wand of Draco Malfoy.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Was? Isn't it still?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Perhaps not -- if you won it from him. I sense its allegiance has changed.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: The wand chooses the wizard, Mr. Potter. That much has always been clear to those of us who have studied wandlore.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: What do you know about the Deathly Hallows, sir?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: There are rumored to be three: The Elder Wand, the Resurrection Stone and the Invisibility Cloak. It is said that to possess them all is to make oneself the Master of Death. But few truly believe such objects exist --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: But you, sir? Do you believe they exist?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You're lying. You know one exists and you told him about it. You told him about the Elder Wand and where to go looking for it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He tortured me! Besides, I conveyed only rumors. There's no guarantee he will find it --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He has found it, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: That's all, sir. We'll leave you to get some rest now.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He's after you, Mr. Potter. If it's true, what you say, that he has the Elder Wand, I'm afraid you really don't stand a chance.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Then I guess I'll just have to kill him before he finds me, sir.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You're sure it's hers?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Positive. Harry turns to the two wands on the table -- the ones he showed Ollivander -- and extends the longest to Hermione.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I reckon you should take this then.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You heard Ollivander. It's Harry's now.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: But I hate that thing -- that's the wand that killed Sirius! How can I hold it and not feel...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: If I can hold it, you can.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: How will we know what it is when we get in there? After all, a Horcrux can be anything.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I'll know. I can't explain. It's like...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: That's a bit scary.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It is, Harry. Did Dumbledore ever say anything to you, something that might explain why --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: No. I just know. When one's near.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: This is the closest I could find to what you described, Hermione.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It's perfect. Thank you, Fleur.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You're leaving, aren't you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: In the morning.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: And Griphook?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He'll be leaving too.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Listen, I don't know what you're up to, but I know goblins. If you've struck any kind of bargain with Griphook, you must be exceptionally careful to live up to it. If you don't... he won't be forgiving.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: The sky has lost a star.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: My father used to say that when a child died. She looks up, smiles.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Yeah. Funny. Listen, Luna, about your father, I don't want you to think I --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I know you understand why my father did what he did, Harry. That's why we don't need to talk about it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Hogwarts?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It's not the place you left, you

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Neither am I.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Always good value. I'll miss her.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: What d'you think?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Wouldn't know you if I didn't know you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You want to tell me what that is?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Sirius gave it to me. He had a matching piece. He said if I ever needed him, all I had to do was look into it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You mean he could see you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Something like that. I don't know. He died before I ever got to use it. The thing is...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Go on.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You'll think I'm mental, but more than once, when I've looked into it -- I think I've seen Dumbledore.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Bloody hell... that's a sight.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Well, how do I look?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Hideous.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Oh dear, I missed a spot, didn't I? Hold still...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Couldn't do anything about that bit in the back that's always flipping up, could you? Dead annoying --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Never mind. I'm good.  That is you in there, isn't it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You can give that to Hermione to hold, all right, Griphook?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Madam Lestrange.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Good morning? Good morning? You're Bellatrix Lestrange, not some dewy-eyed schoolgirl!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Hey. Easy.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: She gives us away and we might as well use that sword to slit our own throats. Understand?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He's right. I was being stupid.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: C'mon. Let's do it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Identification.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I wish to enter my vault.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I see. Very well. Excuse me, won't you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I don't like to be kept waiting.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Next.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He's with me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: They know!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: What do you mean?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: They know she's an imposter! They've been warned!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Madam Lestrange. Would you mind presenting your wand?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: And why should I do that?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Harry, what do we do? Harry...?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It's the bank's policy. I'm sure you understand, given the current climate --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: No, I most certainly do not understand --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I'm afraid I must insist.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Imperio.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Very well, Madam Lestrange. If you will follow me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: But... Bogrod, there have been special instructions regarding the Lestrange vault.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I'm fully aware of that. I'm also aware the Lestranges are one of our oldest and most respected families.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Yes, sir, but our instructions are very specific --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Let me be specific with you, Ricbert. I've run this bank for forty-five years, long before anyone had even heard of a Death Eater. The day may come that they feel they can run this place better than me, but that day has not yet arrived. Am I understood!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Madam, if you will, I will escort you myself.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: How long before they come after us?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: What's that? Up ahead.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I should have known --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: What is that, Griphook?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Griphook! What is that!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Well done. Hey.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: The Thief's Downfall. Washes away all enchantments. Can be deadly.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You don't say.  Just out of interest... is there any other way out of here?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: No.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: What the devil are you all doing down here!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: We need him!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Is this your doing, Griphook? You have no rights here anymore. When you gave up your keys, you --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Imperio!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Well done.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: No. It's not possible...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Bloody hell. That's a Welsh Green.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It looks like it's been down here forever.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Go on.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It's been trained to expect pain when it hears the noise.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: That's barbaric. I...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: We'll only have a few seconds. In other words... they'll be no do-

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Ready, Bogrod?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Hm? Oh. Yes. Of course.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Lumos !

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Lumos !

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Lumos !

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Blimey...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Look.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: No wonder Bellatrix thought it was real.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Is it here, Harry? Can you feel anything?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It's hot! All eyes turn to the bowl, WOBBLING MADLY on the floor, when... it SPLITS APART and begins to MULTIPLY.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Ron, your foot!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: We'll be crushed! Hurry!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: That's it. Up there.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: How're we going to reach it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Give me the sword! The real one.

dialog: Brilliant.

dialog: Nagini. Come.

dialog: You're bloody well welcome!

dialog: Ron, you once asked me if I thought he felt it -- Voldemort -- when we destroy a Horcrux, when we destroy a piece of his soul.

dialog: He does.

dialog: It's the snake. She's the last one. The last Horcrux.

dialog: Where will he take her?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Someplace safe.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: No. He'll keep her close.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Look inside him, Harry.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Find out where he is. If we find him, we find the snake. Then we're one step closer to ending this.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Stop looking at her. She smells your fear. It agitates her. Be grateful she's just eaten.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Forgive me, my Lord, but wouldn't it be more prudent to call off this battle and seek the boy yourself?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I do not need to seek the boy! Before the night is out, he will come to me! Do you understand!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Of c-course, my Lord.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: How do you live with yourself, Lucius?  Go. Find Severus. Tell him I need to see him immediately.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I know where he is.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: There's more to me than incense and tea leaves, Mr. Finnegan.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Thanks.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Don't mention it.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Why doesn't it work for me?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You have performed extraordinary magic with this wand, my Lord. In the last few hours alone --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: No! I am extraordinary! But the wand resists me!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: There is no wand more powerful. Ollivander himself said it. Tonight, when the boy comes to you, it will not fail you, I am sure. It answers to you and you only.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Does it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: My Lord?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: The wand. Does it truly answer to me?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You're a clever man, Severus. Surely you must know.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Where, Severus? Where does its loyalty lie?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: With you, of course, my Lord.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: The Elder Wand cannot serve me properly, Severus, because I am

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: The Elder Wand belongs to the wizard who killed its last owner. Ollivander was quite explicit about that. You killed Dumbledore, Severus. While you live, the Elder Wand cannot be truly mine.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: My Lord --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You have been a good and faithful servant, Severus.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: But only I can live forever...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Kill.

dialog: Nagini! Come!

dialog: Take them...

dialog: Take them!

dialog: Please.

dialog: Give me something! Quickly! A flask! Anything.

dialog: They are the same...

dialog: You have your mother's eyes...

dialog: He's gone. The snake too.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You have fought valiantly... but in vain. I do not wish this. Every drop of magical bliood

dialog: Never! Do you hear me! NEVER!

dialog: Where is everyone?

dialog: She's jealous. Because she's ordinary and you're special.

dialog: That's mean.

dialog: That wasn't my intention.

dialog: Stand up, Severus. I haven't much time. What message do you bring from Lord Voldemort this time?

dialog: Yes.

dialog: How much did you relay?

dialog: Only what I heard. But now... he thinks it refers to her.

dialog: The Prophecy did not refer to a woman. It spoke of a boy born at the end of July --

dialog: Yes! But he thinks it's her son! He intends to hunt them down now! To kill them!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: If she means so much to you, surely Lord Voldemort would spare her in exchange for the boy.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I have asked.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You disgust me. You would sacrifice the life of an innocent child over a schoolboy crush?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: She's more than that! She's different! Beautiful. Kind.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: And should I do so, what will you give me in return, Severus?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Anything.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You said you would keep her safe!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Lily and James put their faith in the wrong person. Rather like you, Severus.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: The boy survives.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He has her eyes.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He doesn't need protection. The Dark Lord has gone --

dialog: The Dark Lord will return. And the boy will be in terrible danger when he does.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: No one can know. Your word.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: My word that I shall never reveal the best of you, Severus? If you insist.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He exhibits no measurable talent. His arrogance rivals even his father's. And he seems to relish his fame.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Sometimes we see what we expect to see, Severus. Other teachers indicate the boy is modest, likeable and while no prodigy, possesses above-average gifts. Personally, I find him rather engaging.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You see what you want to see.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Perhaps. oOh. Severus.

dialog: Why did you put it on? Surely you realized it carried a curse.

dialog: I was... foolish... greedy...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Drink the rest. It will contain the curse to the hand for the time being.

dialog: How long?

dialog: Maybe a year.

dialog: Well, this makes matters much more straightforward.

dialog: Do not ignore me, Severus. Was it not you who told me of Lord Voldemort's plan to have the Malfoy boy murder me?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It is not expected that he will succeed.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You must agree.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Yes. You must be the one to kill me, Severus. It is the only way. Only then will the Dark Lord trust you completely.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You ask too much.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: There will come a time when Harry Potter must be told something. But you must wait until Voldemort is at his most vulnerable.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Tell him what?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: On the night Lord Voldemort went to Godric's Hollow to kill Harry, and Lily Potter cast herself between them, the curse rebounded. When that happened, a part of Lord Voldemort's soul latched itself onto the only living thing it could find: Harry himself.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: There's a reason Harry can speak with snakes. There's a reason he can look into Lord Voldemort's mind. A part of Lord Voldemort lives inside him.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: So when the time comes, the boy must die.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You've kept him alive so that he can die at the proper moment. You've been raising him like a pig for slaughter.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: But this is touching, Severus. Don't tell me you've grown to care for the boy?

dialog: Expecto Patronum!

dialog: Lily. After all this time?

dialog: What is it, Harry? What is it you

dialog: It's all right. We're going to get you inside.

dialog: Don't worry. I won't leave you. I promise.

dialog: You've been so brave, sweetheart.

dialog: Does it hurt? Dying?

dialog: You're nearly there, son.

dialog: I'm sorry. I didn't want any of you to die for me. And Remus, your son...

dialog: Others will tell him what his mother and father died for. Someday he'll understand...

dialog: You'll stay with me?

dialog: Harry Potter. The Boy Who Lived. Come to die. Nagini HISSES behind her protective guard of Death Eaters. Harry's gaze shifts to her when Voldemort raises

dialog: Harry. You wonderful boy. You brave, brave man. Let us walk.

dialog: Sir, this, is this... I mean, forgive me, but you are dead, aren't you, sir?

dialog: Oh, yes.

dialog: Then... I'm dead too?

dialog: Not?

dialog: Not.

dialog: But I didn't defend myself. I let him kill me.

dialog: It's true, isn't it, sir? A bit of him lives in me, doesn't it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Did. It was just destroyed only moments ago by none other than Voldemort himself.

dialog: You were the seventh Horcrux, Harry; the Horcrux he never meant to make.

dialog: And you knew this? That's why you were certain I wouldn't die?

dialog: Certain? No. Little is certain in this world, Harry. Call it an educated guess.

dialog: Professor, is that -- ?

dialog: Exactly where are we, sir?

dialog: I was going to ask you that. Where would you say that we are?

dialog: It looks like King's Cross station -- only a lot cleaner. And without the trains.

dialog: King's Cross! Is that right? Well, this is, as they say, your party.

dialog: Sir, why didn't you just tell me about the Deathly Hallows?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You will have to forgive me, Harry. You see... I didn't trust

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I feared that you would make the same mistake I made, that you would be intoxicated by the power the Hallows promise their possessor. But I crave your pardon, Harry. It's clear to me now, as it should have been all along, that you are the better man.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Sir --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You are the worthy possessor of the Hallows, Harry, not me. I was fit to own the Elder Wand, because I took it not for gain, but to save others from it. But I took the Stone because I longed to recall someone who has long been at peace and for that I paid with my life.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: You wanted to see Ariana again, didn't you, sir?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Yes.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I used the Stone as well, sir, only a little while ago when I entered the Forest. I saw my mum and dad, and Sirius and Lupin...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: True. But ask yourself this: were you calling them? Or were they calling you?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I've got to go back, haven't I?

dialog: That is up to you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I've got a choice?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Oh yes. We are in King's Cross, you say? I think, should you so decide, you would be able to, let's say, board a train.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: And where would it take me?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: On.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Voldemort's got the Elder Wand.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: True.

dialog: And the snake lives.

dialog: Yes.

dialog: And I've nothing to kill it with.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: 'Help will always be given at Hogwarts to those who ask for it.'

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I have always prized my ability to turn a phrase -- words are, in my

dialog: With all due respect, sir, I think what we need here is a miracle.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I've never put much stock in miracles, Harry. On the other hand, I can attest wholly to the extensive advantages of a related phenomenon.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Which would be, sir?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Luck.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living and, above all, those who live without love.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Sir, my mother's Patronus. It was a doe, wasn't it? Just like Professor Snape's. Curious, don't you think?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Actually, if I think about it... it doesn't seem curious at all.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Professor.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Is this real? Or has this been happening inside my head?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry. But why should that mean that it is not real?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: My lord, let me help you --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I do not require assistance.

dialog: The boy. Is he dead?

dialog: Is he alive? Draco?

dialog: Don't despair, Longbottom. I put you in Gryffindor for good reason...

dialog: Who's that?

dialog: Behold, Nagini. Our work is done.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: No... NO!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Stupid girl. You cry for that?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: While your hands ran dark with the blood of mothers and sons, fathers and daughters, brothers and sisters, his were clasped in prayer -- but it was a prayer for one and one only. While you battled courageously, until you could no longer will yourself to stand, he had long since fallen to his knees. While you cursed me until your voices grew ragged, he begged me for mercy in a voice as meek as a child's.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: So do not cry for that. He's not worthy of your tears. And do not despair of his betrayal. You were never in his heart. Not for one single solitary beat.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Liar!

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Did you not hear me! Harry Potter is dead! From this day forward, you put your faith in me or suffer the consequences. HARRY POTTER Is

dialog: Now is the time to declare yourself.

dialog: Draco...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Draco, don't be stupid --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Come, Draco.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: He saved your life.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Well done, Draco. Who will be next? Hm? Come now, don't be shy.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Well, I must say, I'd hoped for better. Is this truly the best Hogwarts has to offer?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Who might you be, young man?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Neville Longbottom.

dialog: Well, welcome, Neville. I'm sure we can find a place for you in our ranks.

dialog: Someone has to do the washing.

dialog: Now, now, Bellatrix. Let's not underestimate our young friend. By stepping forward, he lives to see another day...

dialog: I'd like to say something.

dialog: Very well, Neville. I'm sure we'd all be fascinated to hear what you have to say.

dialog: It doesn't matter that Harry is gone. A troubled MURMUR ripples through the crowd.

dialog: Die! Die

dialog: Confringo!

dialog: Back off, boys! She's mine!  You will never touch my chiidren again!

dialog: Be thankful we only took one. Besides...

dialog: Yes!

dialog: I don't want you to say anything you wouldn't say if we weren't about to be killed by a giant snake! It'll just ruin it!

dialog: You were right.

dialog: When you told Professor Snape it was failing you. It will always fail you.

dialog: It belongs to me! I killed Snape!

dialog: Together.

dialog: What's the matter with her?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: There's more to me than incense and tea leaves, Mr. Finnegan.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: I told you: it's useless to you.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Not exactly leaving the place better than we found it, are we?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Can't make an omelette without breaking a few eggs.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Something my mum used to say.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Why didn't it work for him? The Elder wand.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Because it answers to another.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: When he killed Snape, he thought the wand would become his. But the thing is... it never belonged to Snape.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: But that means...

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: It answers to me.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: What do you reckon we should do with it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: We?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Well, it wasn't boring, was it?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Together?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Don't forget to give Professor Longbottom our best.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Will there really be thestrals pulling the carriages?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: There's nothing scary about thestrals. They're gentle things. Anyway, you won't be going up to school in the carriages. You/'be going in the boats, remember?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Dad?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Yes?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: What if I'm put in Slytherin?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Albus Severus Potter. You were named after two Headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin. And he was probably the bravest man I ever knew.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: But just say I am --

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Then Slytherin House will have gained a wonderful wizard. But listen, if it means so much to you, you can choose Gryffindor. The Sorting Hat takes your choice into account.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Really?

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Really.

movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
dialog: Ready?
